Adventure in Cyrodiil!
Adventure in Skyrim!
Follow the path of a Daedra!
Choose some other options!
1.content:
"Stand up, there you go. You were dreaming. What's your name?" -Jiub, 3E 427

Welcome to Tamriel! Thus marks the start of your days as an adventurer, or perhaps something much more sinister. However, before you can begin your quest, you must first decide... who's story will you follow?

There are three different adventurers to choose from: a native of Morrowind (Elder Scrolls III), a native of Cyrodiil (Elder Scrolls IV), or a native of Skyrim (Elder Scrolls V). All three of them have different options for journeys to go on, as well as different fates: terrifying dungeons and hungry predators of all kinds await them.

Or, instead, you can play as a Daedra. Natives of oblivion, the Daedra have potential to cause all kinds of havoc in Oblivion or the overworld. Of course, there are numerous to choose from, each with their own characteristics.

Finally, you can choose from some other options.

So, without further ado, who's journey will you follow today?
1.title: Welcome to Tamriel!

choices: Exploring a dungeon in search of treasure
Doing work for the Mages' Guild
Paying tribute to Lady Azura
Travelling the Vvardenfell countryside
Being kidnapped and tied up!
11.content:
Name: Avoni Indalen
Sex: Female
Race: Dunmer (Dark Elf)
Class: Nightblade (Magic + Stealth)
Faction affiliations: House Redoran, Guild of Mages
Religion: Worshipper of Azura

The year is 427 in the third era, and, like most of the land's native Dunmer inhabitants, Avoni finds her future to be quite uncertain. A young dark elf girl belonging to House Redoran but of Ashlander descent, Avoni was a freelance adventurer in a time and place where adventuring had never been more profitable: with the Tribunal temple struggling to maintain control over the Ghostfence, the capital at Mournhold struggling with internal affairs, and the joke of an Imperial Legion weaker than ever, it seemed that there was nothing standing in the way of the average adventurer who wanted to make a name for their self.

Of course, there was nothing to stop the various beasts and monsters that made Morrowind infamous from roaming about and causing problems for these would-be adventurers.

Avoni was only one of these would-be adventurers. With typical grey skin, Avoni's round red eyes poked out from behind her dark bangs, more often than not covered by the hood of a robe which also completely masked her small, petite figure. Her fighting style was closest to that of a "nightblade", which meant that she used stealth tactics to get around, supported heavily by an arsenal of magic. It was a class commonly associated with rogues and thieves, which suited Avoni well... although she wasn't quite a thief, she wasn't exactly the most experienced adventurer, either, which led to her running away a lot...

Today is a new day, and a new adventure. What is Avoni doing today?
11.title: Bio: Avoni the Dunmer Nightblade, Morrowind

choices: A modest-looking ancestral tomb
Towering but decrepit Dwarven ruins
A menacing and heavily-guarded Daedric shrine
111.content:
Avoni sighed with relief as she stepped over the hill, delighted to see her destination in front of her at last. Although more of her raids ended in failure than not (and by "failure", meaning barely escaping with her life), the dunmer was no stranger to the solo dungeon raid, and knew that one sometimes had to travel a significant distance to find the best loot.

So, taking a break from Guild work (which was pretty sparse for someone of her low rank anyway), the adventurer made her way to Dagon Fel by boat, and from there, by foot. It was quite a trek, but she had managed to arrive just before sunset at her destination. Now, Avoni stood in front of the dungeon, bracing herself for what traps and challenges lay ahead.

In front of Avoni was...
111.title: Dungeoneering

choices: Take a stealthy approach like usual, and sneak inside the tomb.
Prepare for battle, and summon an Ancestor Ghost for help!
1111.content:
Avoni gave a sigh as she approached the door of her next dungeon: a tomb with the family name "Senim" engraved in Daedric characters on its entrance. Ancestral tombs were an integral part of Dunmer culture, and were located all over the island continent. Her own namesake, Indalen, even had one, nestled between the steep hills that surrounded the Imperial town Caldera - although, with her current lifestyle, the young Dunmer silently worried if she would actually be interred there, instead of in a ditch by some bandit camp or in the intestines of some hungry monster...

Avoni exhaled another breath as she examined the entrance of the crypt. Tombs like these were all generally built in the same style - they had modest doors, downward passageways, and some winding halls and rooms of various sizes, full of burial urns filled with ashes and other valuable trinkets buried with their former owners. However, other than that, there was no telling who else would be inside - sometimes, Avoni got lucky, and the tombs were either empty or full of some restless undead. Other times, she was not as much, and ran into bandits or necromancer or vampires, or, worst of all, Daedra.

Of course, the nightblade wouldn't know what approach to take in this dungeon until she got a glimpse of her enemy. For that reason, she usually preferred to sneak in. However, if the enemy within were truly powerful and noticed her before she noticed it, she would be in big trouble, especially if she were alone...
1111.title: Senim Ancestral Tomb

choices: A re-animated skeleton stands guard, facing the opposite direction.
Problems - it's a big, menacing Daedroth, and it's noticed her...
11111.content:
Avoni sighed as she approached the door, deciding not to summon one of her ancestors for help. She was much better at stealth than she was at combat, the latter being her only option if she used a summoned being's help. Besides, the only ghost she could ever seem to summon was that of her ancestor Lilethys, who had been getting very impatient with her lately...

Nope, she decided, it wasn't worth it. Casting only a quick detect life spell to help her out, the Dunmer girl approached the door alone and gives it a tug, feeling it pull open with a heavy creak.

Flinching at the noise, Avoni crept into the tomb and pulled the door shut behind her, crouching down and assuming her sneaking form in the dark, barely-lit hallway. All at once, the musty, damp air of the familial resting place filled her lungs. Although the characteristic thick air of these tombs once made Avoni cough, years of dungeon crawling had so accustomed her to such things that she barely noticed it anymore.

Besides, coughing was absolutely out of the question.

Creeping down the stairs, Avoni hugged close to the wall as her little feet slowly carried her downward, making no audible sounds as she descended. The air slowly began to cool as her altitude decreased, slowly traveling down the narrow stairwell towards the tight turn in the corridor up ahead.

Reaching the bottom of the stairs, Avoni stopped for a moment. In front of her was sharp turn, beyond the corner of which she couldn't see. Judging by feeling her detect life spell was giving her, Avoni could tell that there was a small chamber just around the bend, with something standing there, unmoving. However, she couldn't tell what it was. Clutching her dagger in hand, and preparing herself for a sneak attack, Avoni slowly leaned in to the corner and peeked...
11111.title: Solo Graverobbing

choices: The Daedroth takes Avoni to its master, deep in the tomb!
The Daedroth is hungry, and Avoni just looks too good...
111112.content:
(Reference image: http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/elde... )

Although she was expecting something like a skeleton warrior, or, at worst, a bonelord, Avoni was shocked to see a tremendous Daedroth prowling in the room ahead. Standing at eight feet tall, the massive, bipedal reptilian creature was strapped with muscle and covered in dull scales. Huge yellowed teeth poked out of its massive, alligator-like jaws, and its eyes shifted back and forth.

Either the powerful creature had sensed her before she had seen it, or it had just so happened to be looking her way when she poked around the corner, but the creature had noticed her. This was, of course, very bad for Avoni, whose eyes widened when she saw the monster's eyes narrow, as it began to walk toward her.

Quickly powering up a spell, Avoni fired at the Daedra who, due to its size, took the blast head on. The Daedroth recovered quickly enough, however, and charged at Avoni, letting out a roar. The dunmer girl dodged its attacks and pulled out her dagger, just quick enough to escape its clutches.

However, even though the Daedroth was hulking enough to hit once, it was far from slow. Before Avoni could regain her stance, the creature fired off a magical attack, hitting her and sending her flying. Avoni yelped as she flew backwards and hit the wall, having forgotten about the magical capabilities all Daedra had...

Whimpering with pain, Avoni swung her dagger at the advancing beast, only to have it swipe the weapon out of her hand with one powerful claw. A moment later, the Dunmer's entire world was upside down as the Daedroth grabbed her and hoisted her up by her legs. Avoni screamed as she wiggled about, helpless in the creature's grip as it sniffed her, mouth watering...
111112.title: A Lurking Daedroth

choices: The ghost reluctantly agrees to come along, and the two head inside.
Something else appears, and interrupts the two's conversation...
11112.content:
Deciding that she's better off playing it safe with a companion, Avoni's hands begin to shake as she prepares to exercise a power inherent to all Dunmer - the ability to summon an ancestral guardian for a limited period of time.

Of course, it wasn't something that just any Dark Elf could do, but Avoni was a devout of Azura and her ancestors, and had mastered the technique. There weren't many advantages to summoning an ancestor ghost - they couldn't do much besides fight and occasionally provide guidance, and the summons didn't last long. Still, they were great to use in a pinch, and didn't require a share of the loot - a factor that made them very attractive options to adventurers like herself.

A flash of light surrounds Avoni as she waves her hand, magicka flowing from her fingertips as she invokes her greater power, forming little clouds of light and a whoosh of magical sound. Moments later, the light clears, revealing a ghostly, translucent Dunmer female. She glowed a slight greenish color, and her legs seemed to be absent in favor of a ghostly tendril, allowing her to hover just above the ground. Her torso was scantily clad but nonetheless athletic looking, and her young-looking face did nothing to betray the history or age of the long-dead woman, aside from her antiquated hairstyle and chitin piercings.

"Avoni!" The ghost yelled, frowning as she turned to the wide-eyed Dunmer girl. "What are you doing?! I was enjoying a peaceful rest. Why did you summon me again?"

"Ah... s-sorry, Lilethys..." Avoni stammered, apologetically. "But I'm going into this dungeon and I need help..."

"Help? Come on..." the ghost named Lilethys whined. "You always summon me for the most ridiculous things. I will not help you rob another tomb of somebody's ancestors!"

"What?!" Avoni cried, instantly becoming distraught. "Come on... please? It's not OUR ancestors... who cares about these guys! Besides... aren't you supposed to, you know... protect me and stuff? If I go in all alone, I might get...eaten up or something..."

Avoni shuffles in place as she looks up at her ancestor's ghost, pleading with wide-eyes for her help.
11112.title: Lilethys Indalen, Ancestral Ghost

choices: The Dwemer Puzzle Cube
The Fistful of Shimmering yet Sticky Gems
1112.content:
The steam powered hatch groans shut behind you. Inside the ancient Dwemer ruin, the ambient noise of pistons and steam resonates all around. Though dimly lit, Avoni is able to make her way down several already looted corridors without trouble. A number of scarab corpses, already stripped of their inner workings, are testament to the previous adventurers' visit. A few footprints mark the floor, but their tracks are filled with dust, nobody has visited this place in quite a long time.

Reaching a fork in the tunnel system, Avoni turns left, only to find that pathway blocked by a pile of rubble and fallen metal pipes and beams. With a shrug, she turns back to the right and continues deeper into the clanking cave. Ahead there is a large square room, lit dimly(but more brightly than the preceding corridors) by a pit of exposed magma. A rusted Dwemer workbench stands against a wall, upon it Avoni can see several objects. Moving closer one is definitely a Dwemer puzzle cube, an interesting nick-knack but worthless in terms of resale value. On the other end of the bench is a small pile of cut gemstones, rubies, emeralds and even a diamond glitter in the red firelight.

As Avoni steps up to the bench she feels something on her left boot. Looking down she sees a puddle of glowing green ectoplasm. With a disgusted shake she manages to get most of the slime off her boot, but can't help but notice there are several more puddles on the floor around the bench. Looking at the piled gems, they too appear to have had a handful of the glop poured on top of them.

Which item does Avoni grab first?
1112.title: Towering but decrepit Dwarven ruins

choices: Pull out her Steel Dagger and Slash the Dwemer Ghost
Attempt to Channel a Fire Spell Between her Trapped and Free Hands
11122.content:
As Avoni reaches out for the gems, a spectral hand phases through her arm before solidifying into a firm fist grasping her wrist. "Mine!" a haunting voice speaks from behind her. Twisting her head around, Avoni sees a Dwemer spirit, hovering directly behind her! As it moves to grasp her other arm, Avoni spins in place, facing her attacker. With only one arm free, she pushes against the spectral being, but feels her hand sinking into the ghost's incorporeal torso like it was thick mud. Panicking, Avoni yanks her hand back while trying to quickly decide what to do as the spectre looms closer, almost in her face now.

What does Avoni do?
11122.title: The Fistful of Shimmering yet Sticky Gems

111221.content:
Quickly Avoni yanks out her trusty steel weapon. With a determined slash she cuts the Dwemer ghost across the chest, just below where it connects to its head! Ectoplasm leaks out, spilling down the entity's torso. For a moment, the grip on her arm slackens and the ghost seems to deflate, pausing in mid-air. But in the next instant the bleeding slime is absorbed and the cut disappears. The loosened grip tightens once more and the ghost advances again. The attack was useless! Why had she tried to attack a ghost without a silver weapon? Cursing, Avoni moved to channel a fireball, but it was now too late. The Dwemer grasped her free hand and hovered its face above her own. "Mine." It spoke, in a determined and triumphant tone.

Pressed up against the workbench and unable to move, Avoni wriggled in place as the Dwemer ghost opened its maw wide and slid down over her head. The room, which had been a dark shade of red, shifted to a sickly green. Avoni could see through the ectoplasmic 'flesh' of her attacker, but only in the direction her face was pointed, Avoni was stiffly held in place by the being's pseudo muscles. It felt like she was being consumed by a giant spoiled fortify fatigue potion, a nauseating stench and disgusting cloying assaulted her sense. The slimy throat slid over her shoulders, binding her arms to her sides. As more of her slid inside the ghost's malleable body, she was bowed forward, almost at a right angle at her hips.

As the ghost struggled to pull more of the lithe Dunmer woman inside itself, Avoni was lifted an inch off the metal flooring and held hovering in the air. In the next movement, she was pushed and pulled forward, spinning and tumbling around the axis of her hips. With physics as her enemy, Avoni was crumpled mercilessly into the stomach of the creature, unable to brace herself against the sticky, glutinous skin. Upside down now Avoni felt her torso and legs pressing down on her as they were shoved into the cramped but elastic stomach. Sensing victory, the Dwemer took a few last swallows, forcing her bare, smooth, dark-skinned legs down into the belly with the rest.

With a contented burp, the Dwemer ghost patted its now round belly, gazing fondly at the Dunmer maiden floating helplessly within. "Mine." It said happily.

As she pressed at the yielding but unbreakable walls of slime, Avoni could feel her bare skin and her clothing begin to break down. It wasn't the bite of acid, but just an unmaking of her body and organic items. Lifting a hand in front of her face, she watched as it turned to goop, fingers turning translucent then losing cohesion, sloughing off herself and congealing in a growing puddle around her. She could feel it all over, not pain, just the loss of extremities. She couldn't wiggle her toes anymore, because they did not exist. Her legs and arms followed and she became a torso and head hanging in a bolus of green ectoplasm, her own green ectoplasm.

She felt the ooze creep between her pursed lips and fill her mouth. Moments later, she lost consciousness as her unique form collapsed. Where minutes before a daring Dunmer adventurer had stood, now only a sack of bubbling green goo hung in space. Sensing his meal was finished processing, the ghost released its bowels, such as they were. A pile of Avoni ectoplasm plummeted the four feet to the floor, splattering on contact. A small ring of alteration magic, four weak potion bottles and her steel dagger clattered among the remains.

Floating closer to the floor, the Dwemer swept the dagger and potions into the magma pit, before lifting the small ring with its ghostly hands. "Mine." It spoke again, pleased. Placing the shiny, though sticky, ring next to the piled jewels on the bench; the ghost faded from sight, happily haunting its cache of treasure.

What was left of Avoni quietly dribbled into the cracks in the floor, before settling in place, surrounded by the puddled remains of the many other hapless adventurers too stupid to use magic or silver weapons against ghosts.
111221.title: Pull out her Steel Dagger and Slash the Dwemer ...

choices: Return to town and visit a Merchant.
Investigate the Bandit Camp a short ways down the path.
111222.content:
After a brief moment concentrating the volatile magic between her hands, Avoni releases the red magic, willing it forward, directly into the Dwemer ghost. The impact burns a crater in the phantasmal flesh and the ghost pulls back, releasing Avoni's hand in order to heal itself. Now able to concentrate completely on casting, Avoni casts another fire sphere and then another. The plasma balls impact on the Dwemer ghost, ripping it to pieces, shreds of ectoplasm falling to the floor. Taking a deep breath, Avoni collects herself, grateful to have survived an encounter she was not prepared for.

After coming so close to being beaten in her first fight, Avoni decided discretion was the better part of valor. Sweeping the gems from the bench into her bag she beat a hasty retreat to the ruin's entrance. As soon as the heavy iron door wheezed shut behind her she felt much better. The relative safety and comfort of the cliffracer infested wastes was much preferable to the claustrophobic maze of machinery.

What should Avoni do next?
111222.title: Attempt to Channel a Fire Spell Between her Tra...

choices: The door with footsteps behind it
The door with snoring behind it
1112221.content:
Returning to Balmora, Avoni decides to pawn the handful of gems and other miscellaneous items she found on her brief but perilous adventure. Though late in the day, the pawnshop is still open. Heading inside, Avoni finds the broker is absent. Striding up to the counter she looks around, examining the walls and shelves lined by miscellaneous items, looking for perhaps some magical equipment to upgrade her capabilities with.

Though there are a few high-quality but well worn robes, there are no magical items of note. Getting impatient, Avoni looks around, wondering where the pawnbroker could be. Noticing two doors leading from the storefront, Avoni listens at both. Behind one door, she can hear a pair of footsteps walking back and forth. Behind the second door she hears snoring.

Which door should Avoni open?
1112221.title: Return to town and visit a Merchant.

choices: Edwinna asks her to study some local wildlife
A fellow Guild member needs help with a spell
Avoni is sent to Mournhold, the capital of Morrowind
112.content:
Even though the Vvardenfell Guild of Mages was a much more westernized institution compared to the majority of the land's other factions, it was still a powerful organization, with branches in several major cities across the island. Of these, the Ald-Ruhn branch was probably the most opulent and large, not because it was particularly better than any of the others, but moreso just because of its location - the building was simply one of many spacious accommodations in the seat of House Redoran.

As a budding magic user, Avoni was excited to be a part of the Guild, simply because of the opportunity it offered her. Although she was merely an associate, the lowest rank possible, she was still able to use some of the Guild's services, although, like everybody else, she hoped to increase her rank.

Entering the Guild in the early morning, Avoni quickly sought out the local head of the Guild - a Breton woman named Edwinna Elbert - and, finding her organizing old books about the Dwemer, managed to get her attention.

"Umm... good morning, Miss Elbert..." the elf began, shuffling in place.

"What do you want? I'm kind of... oh" Edwinna began, cutting herself off when she saw the young elf's face. "I'm sorry, what was your name again?"

"Avoni, Miss."

"Oh, that's right... I promised you a job, didn't I?" Edwinna sighed, and began to think while Avoni waited, a smile on her face. "Uhh... Okay, I've got it."
112.title: Vvardenfell Guild of Mages

choices: Explore the city! See what sights there are to see.
This is the city of the living Goddess Almalexia. Visit her temple.
What do you do in a new place? Explore dungeons! Or sewers...
1123.content:
"We could....do with somebody in Mournhold. You know Mournhold right? It's your capital after all, seat of the King among other things." Elbert started, speaking a little arrogantly as she did so "I've heard tell of an intriguing fellow in the city who has started work on a Robot Arena as it's called. In truth it's basically just salvaged and no doubt hastily put together Dwemer technology, but I know of very few people who can work such things. Therefore I want you....Avoni, to find him and pen notes. See what he's done, see what you can learn and report back to me. Understood?"

The Dunmer girl suffice to say wasn't perhaps as ecstatic as she was walking in. She expected a bit more exciting work, perhaps field experience in learning and casting better magic! Being nothing more than an informant or akin to a journalist wasn't really engaging work and she thought Edwinna could have just got somebody outside of the Guild to do it. On the other hand she was of the lowest rank so doing lowly work was something to be expected, and getting in the good graces of a high ranking member would surely benefit in the long-term!

Truthfully Edwinna just wanted the girl out of her hair so she could continue with her work. She already knew everything she needed about the man.

With some hastily given instructions and a dismissive wave, Avoni was sent on her way to Ebonheart. Ebonheart was a predominantly Imperial settlement on Vvardenfell and it showed in the architecture. For all intents and purposes, she could have fooled herself into thinking she was in the Imperial heartland rather than on the frontier! Especially with the multitude of foreign faces around. But she had a job to do and there wasn't much to sight-see anyways! As travel between Vvardenfell and the Mainland was forbidden under conventional means due to the quarantine, she had to see a Mages Guild associate named Asciene Rane who provided teleportation. After a brief exchange and a flash of light, Avoni found herself in entirely different surroundings.

"Another one?" a gruff voiced sounded behind the young Elven girl, making her turn around in shock to find a heavily armoured man stood before her. His armour was red and shiny, clearly well kept and clean with a V-slit view in the helm and a chainmail skirt around the bottom of the breastplate. "You look confused, don't you know where you are? This is the Royal Palace."

"A-ah the Palace, so this is Mournhold?" Avoni stammered in reply, looking around at her surroundings. She seemed to be in an atrium of sorts and the walls and decorations did seem very regal.

"Just so. I guess I should be the first to greet you. Welcome to Mournhold, city of light, city of magic!"

Contrary to many house guards and certainly Ordinators of Vvardenfell, the guard seemed to be relatively amiable and friendly, even providing instructions on places to visit. Mournhold is a large city and easy to get lost in he said, and like any large city it had its places to visit...and places to avoid. Finding the robot arena wouldn't be easy but maybe information could be gathered while exploring. Mournhold is also known as Almalexia, and is the seat of the Goddess of the same name. A visit to her temple could be worthwhile! On the other hand it's been awhile since flexing those muscles, and the sewers are renown for being vast and full of treasure the deeper you go. The city guard may pay for clearing them out too!

Choices...choices...
1123.title: City of Light, City of Magic!

choices: Avoni is suddenly attacked by a wild Cliff Racer!
Avoni stumbles upon a pack of wild Guars
Avoni is ambushed by bandits!
114.content:
The ashes blow calmly across the ground as Avoni walks through Vvardenfell's iconic Ashlands, en route from the city of Ald'Ruhn to the Ghostgate at the southern foot of Red Mountain to deliver a few potions to members of House Redoran stationed there. The young Dunmer girl walked with a sense of purpose, as it wasn't often that she was trusted with a task from the higher-ups of the great house, and this was something easy enough that even she could do.

However, things weren't always that simple, especially for Avoni, who seemed to have a knack for getting into trouble. As simple as her task seemed, the Ashlands were far from the safest place in Morrowind, and the young Nightblade's quest was momentarily interrupted when...
114.title: Travelling the Vvardenfell countryside

choices: Avoni is prey, and it's feeding time!
Another creature comes along, and joins in the fight!
1141.content:
Avoni gasps and jumps in surprise as she hears the familiar call of Morrowind's most hated creature - the cliff racer. These flying, pterodactyl-like creatures were infamous for being extremely fast and hard to hit, and for their tendency to swarm on unsuspecting travelers.

Despite their relatively common appearance in the Ashlands, Avoni is caught rather off guard by the creature swooping down her, and barely dodges out of the way.

"Ack..." she groans as she hits the ground, rushing to regain her stance before it comes back. "Damned things, I'll show you! Hah!" Avoni yells, firing off a fireball at the winged menace - her primary offensive weapon. However, the cliff racer easily dodges, and swoops at her again, causing her to dive out of the way once more.

A few more missed fireballs later, Avoni realizes that she's going to have to resort to melee combat to fight this thing off. Hands shaking, she pulls out her weapon - an enchanted silver shortsword - and brandishes it in self-defense. Yelping with fear, Avoni swings the weapon hard at her attacker, only to miss once again.

What follows is a short battle in which the winged avian claws at the helpless Dunmer, knocking her to the ground hard and sending her weapon flying to the side. Groaning with pain, Avoni rolls onto her back, only to see the Cliff Racer standing over her bruised body, saliva dripping from its slightly open beak, and its belly rumbling a few feet away...
1141.title: Cliff Racer Attack!

choices: The stomach begins to squeeze her upward, forcing her back up its throat!
The cliff racer relaxes, and begins to digest its meal...
11411.content:
Avoni stares, wide-eyed and frozen with fear as the cliff racer stands over her, surveying her beaten body. Then, the Dunmer screams as the creature chomps down on her, clamping its beak down over her and hoisting her high in the air. Avoni gasps as she's lifted high up, her entire world flipping upside down as she finds herself pointing vertically downward into the creature's maw, her legs flailing wildly outside of its beak as its slimy tongue slathers her face with sticky saliva.

"NO, MMMMF!" She screams as she feels herself slide downward into the beast's open throat, her head forcing into its gullet with a thick gluuurk as the cliff racer begins to hungrily devour her whole. Avoni watches in helpless horror as she's forced easily down into the cliff racer's rippling, pulsing throat, sliding headfirst down as she realizes she's actually being eaten alive.

*gluuurk* *gulllp* *gluurp*

Feeling her head push through a ring of muscle and into an open chamber, Avoni gasps for breath but instantly gags. Her face presses down into a fleshy wall as she feels her legs and feet enveloped in the same wet tightness, only to be swallowed down as well, leaving her curled up upside-down inside of the cliff racer's gurgling, churning stomach.

Struggling to right herself, Avoni begins to panic. Oh Azura, what's going on?! she thinks to herself, gagging on the foul stench of rotted flesh. The dread quickly sinks into her as she realizes that she's inside of the cliff racer's stomach - swallowed whole as if she were its prey. All around her, the stomach gently swings as Avoni sits curled up inside, the slimy walls rubbing against her in between deep groans, swinging left and right with every flap of its wings.

Great... she thinks to herself, as the oppressive heat bears down on her and the churning stomach walls noisily cover her in mucus. Not only could I not even kill a stupid cliff racer, but now I'm it's dinner... I remember training in situations on how to fight off wild animals, but nobody's ever told me what to do AFTER they eat me...

Avoni's train of thought is interrupted when she notices the potions she had been sent to deliver - ten exclusive restore fatigues - spilled out on the stomach floor, churning around her in a frothy pool of potion and bile. That train of thought is also interrupted as the stomach groans incredibly loudly, squeezing down on her body, and...
11411.title: Dinner for a cliff racer

choices: Right into the mouth of a hungry chick
Right into the nest, where the babies begin to fight over her
114111.content:
Avoni yelps again as the fleshy stomach begins to churn, squeezing hard on her body and tearing what was left of her robe into tatters, leaving her in her underwear, the hot flesh of the cliff racer's stomach walls squeezing against her bare skin for a moment before forcing her body back up into its throat with a loud SCHLURK.

Yes, yes, it's vomiting me up! Avoni thought, her heart filling with excited relief as she is roughly forced back up the creature's gullet with wet, heavy gags. Moments later, however, the Dunmer's hopes were shattered as her slime-covered head pokes out of its tight gullet and back into it's mouth, as its beak slowly opened...

Massive portals to "The Deadlands", a fiery, hellish plane of Oblivion controlled by the Daedra Lord Mehrunes Dagon, are open all around the countryside, allowing demons to seemingly just walk right into broad daylight and cause trouble for the good people of the empire.

Of course, the Khajiit Skasha was just one of many who found their lives all but unaffected by the so-called "crisis". In no quick hurry to join the Imperial Legion to fight off the advancing Daedra, Skasha instead competed in the Imperial City Arena for fun and money when she had free time.

However, first and foremost, Skasha was a Dark Brotherhood assassin - a member of the secret society dedicated to the worship of Sithis, the primordial god of chaos and death. Serving the society as a mid-ranking member, Skasha carries out assassinations with her own particular style: After defeating enemies through a combination of stealth and skill with daggers and thrown weapons, the Khajiit has the power to, if she so chooses to, devour them whole and absorb their power - an arcane combination of necromancy and mysticism that she obtained while studying the dark arts.

Skasha is a Khajiit with the power to swallow whole and digest people up to the same size as her. However, this power is useless on the various demons of the world who eclipse her in size, and, should she become careless, she could just as easily become a meal for something much scarier than her...

Today is another day for an assassin in Cyrodiil. What is Skasha doing today?
12.title: Bio: Skasha the Khajiit Assassin, Cyrodiil

choices: Cheydinhal, looking for prey to kidnap and bring home...
Bruma, stalking prey and following it home...
Imperial City, hiding in the alley with a stomach already full!
123.content:
For Skasha, "hunting" meant something very different from roaming the wilds with a bow and arrow. No... for the experienced Khajiit assassin, hunting was simply preying upon those weaker than her, defeating them, and finally consuming them. There was nothing particularly immoral about this, she thought. Skasha had a belly to fill just like anybody else! Only, for her, her hunger was much deeper, and filling her stomach just felt that much greater...

In addition to the ecstatic feeling, eating and digesting prey allowed Skasha to absorb their powers and add to her own. As such, nightly huntings became almost a ritual for her, not only to satisfy her growling belly but also to become stronger, like a form of training.

Where was Skasha's hunting ground tonight?
123.title: Searching For Prey

choices: Skasha decides to find out where the girl lives... or, rather, "lived"...
A guard hears her burp, and comes to investigate!
1233.content:
*BRAAAAP*

Skasha quickly covers her mouth on the tail end of a tremendous belch, crouching down and leaning against the wall in a dark back alley in the Imperial City's Elven Gardens district. Her tremendously bloated belly stretches out in front of her, throbbing and pulsing with little bulges as her living prey struggles inside of her stomach. Having spotted her target - a young, slender Imperial woman - walking alone through the dark alley, Skasha had seized her chance and leapt upon her, restraining her and swallowing her without so much as a scream.

"Ahh... what a satisfying meal..." Skasha begins, purring as she kneads her bulging, squirming prey, pressing her fingers into her gut and feeling the outline of the girl inside of her. Skasha smiles deviously as her belly groans and gurgles, its thick churns just masking the girl's sobs and pleads.

*gluuurgle*

Inside of Skasha's churning, frothing belly, her prey cries out in protest as the fleshy stomach walls knead and churn against her bare skin. "STOP!" She screamed, her tiny sobs barely audible over the onslaught of Skasha's bodily noises. "You can't... you can't do this to me! Please don't eat me..." Little bulges continued to appear on the stomach in response, as the girl continued to push outward from inside of Skasha's stomach, unable to accept her new role as the Khajiit's food.

Skasha rolls her eyes as she pats her furry belly, feeling it squeeze and knead on her prey, filling the Khajiit with a sadistic satisfaction. "But girl, I already ate you. You have the honor of being my meal for the night, so welcome to my stomach..."

Skasha gives a slight hiccup before letting out another wet belch, hearing a little cry from her prey as she feels her churning belly clench down on her prey. Pleasure surged through Skasha as she felt her meal squirm within her, crying out for release that wouldn't come. But how to enjoy this more, before she started digesting her...?
1233.title: Belly Full of Cat Food

Go hunt some bandits
Explore aimlessly! Find all the things!
124.content:
Today was just another average day for Skasha as she prowled about the roads of central Cyrodiil. It was pleasantly sunny, which even a shadowy assassin like herself could appreciate, and the fields around her seemed peaceful. Deer were frolicking, the more dangerous animals were distracted and-

"Oh Sithis's tits, this is boring!" Skasha yelled to... no one in particular. She needed something to do, and hopefully soon. She could go "questing" if she wanted, there were always people willing to pay for their problems to disappear. Other than that, she could explore some of the old forts to get some practice on some unsuspecting bandits.

Or she could just wander into the wilds off the roads; the monsters and beasts out there are dangerous, but they'll give her some definite entertainment.

Fighting against the Imperials in a huge battle!

In the year 201 of the fourth era, Skryim was a land of conflicting voices, many of which held sway over some but antagonized others. Lorana was a young nord girl who, when she spoke, others listened. It wasn't just because of her position as an hot-headed Stormcloak, nor was it solely due to her skill with a broadsword and a set of armor, a skill that made her fearsome in her own right. It wasn't even her appearance as a slim but toned, fair-skinned nord with naturally straight blonde hair, piercing blue eyes, buxom chest, and a tight, round ass.

Though all of these things certainly made Lorana a very popular person, there was one other thing: Lorana was the illegitimate daughter of a Greybeard monk, a fact that was a poorly-kept secret among her friends and comrades at Windhelm. Although the need for secrecy kept her from visiting her father very often, the old monk couldn't stop himself from teaching her a thing or two every time she made the pilgrimage to see him, just for the sake of wanting to keep his only daughter safe and properly equipped.

As a result of this relationship, Lorana was not only a nord warrior, a beauty, and a force to be reckoned with, but she could also - to some extent - use dragon shouts to aid her in battle.

With that said, what is the nord girl doing today?
13.title: Bio: Lorana the Nord warrior, Skyrim

choices: Gain the power to shrink yourself!
Gain the power to shrink others!
Gain the power to devour others whole, and absorb their souls!
131.content:
"Lorana"

That was all she heard, and all she needed to hear - her name whispered into her ear from someone miles away, in the smallest hours of the night, right before she fell asleep. Her father had a peculiar way of contacting his daughter: instead of the tremendous, rumbling summons that greybeards typically used, echoing across the lands for all to hear (or, Talos forbid, writing an actual letter), Lorana's dad could whisper a single word into someone's ear from miles away, simply provided he knew where they were. It was a magnificent trick, and one that even put the hard-headed Nord girl in awe.

So, once again, Lorana found herself making the pilgrimage up the seven thousand steps to High Hrothgar. It was a trip she had made a few times before, and had gotten quite good at. So, she arrived atop Throat of the World without much effort just on the edge of Twilight, as the snow began to fall once again. Coming up on the Greybeard's monastery, she did not stop to offer tributes as most pilgrims did, but rather marched right up the steps towards an old, hooded figure, who stood waiting for her. "Hey, Dad!"

"Lorana..." the old man grumbled, quickly embracing his daughter before continuing, "Quickly, hurry inside..."

~ ~ ~

Inside the dark halls of High Hrothgar, Lorana and her father - the old Greybeard named Valund - sat talking, catching up on past events since her last visit the previous year.

"I'm very happy to see you well, Lorana..." Valund continued, "and I know the Civil War has escalated, and the Dovah have become more aggressive... I cannot help but worry. I have a new power to teach you, but you must heed the utmost caution..."

"Yeah, come on..." Lorana interrupted, in her usual fashion, "I know what I'm doing! Let's hear it!"

"I'm serious, Lorana!" Valund grunted, his voice filled with a careful urgency. "This new shout is difficult to use, but incredibly powerful, and can be incredibly dangerous if misused. With this new shout, you will..."
131.title: A New Kind of Dragon Shout

choices: Lorana goes into the forest to shrink herself
Lorana goes home to shrink herself in the Stormcloak barracks
Lorana shrinks herself in the middle of a fight
1311.content:
"You will gain the power to shrink yourself..." Valund continued, his face becoming serious. "...to a height of one inch. It's a new kind of dragon shout, one that was not previously known to us. There are... implications, of course." the stern Greybeard noted, "Because, I do not know if the shout gives you any other advantages. By shrinking yourself, you could be putting yourself in extreme danger. Of course, I'm sure I don't need to tell you, but this could be a sort of last ditch effort to escape trouble. By becoming tiny, you could escape from any prison, hide from any enemy, and nobody would ever suspect..."

"WOW!" Lorana interrupted, her voice filling with glee. "I can become tiny?! That's AMAZING!"

"Lorana!" Valund yelled, the entire monastery shaking from the power of his Greybeard voice. "...Lorana. Please. I will teach you this shout, but you need to promise me that you will only use it as an absolute last resort! Do you understand?"

"Yeah, yeah..." the Nord girl casually replied. "Come on, teach me it!"

"Very well." Valund sighed. "I will lend you some of my power. Come, and listen closely. Here are the words..."

Inscriptions suddenly appeared on the floor, in glowing letters of an arcane language. Lorana, of course, had no trouble reading them at all: MAL, KOPRAAN, FILOK

"Be very careful. If you use the first word, you will remain shrunken for one hour. The second word will shrink you for three days, and all three will permanently make you tiny." Valund warned. "We do not yet know how to reverse this, so take care NOT to use all three words... understood?"

"Yeah, got it!" Lorana replied, her heart already filling with excitement.

~ ~ ~

A day passed, and Lorana left High Hrothgar after bidding her father farewell. As soon as she left the monastery, however, she was instantly filled with the excitement to try out her new shout.

This is going to be so great! She thought to herself, considering her options. I HAVE to try this one out right away... but where to begin?
1311.title: The Shrinking Nord

choices: "MAL!"
"MAL, KOPRAAN!"
"MAL, KOPRAAN, FILOK!"
13111.content:
Brimming with excitement, Lorana runs down the thousand steps towards Ivarstead at a speed many would consider suicidal. Taking as many shortcuts as she could by jumping and sliding down the mountain, she quickly reaches the town to find her favorite horse, which she named Mil, tied up where she left her. Anybody around knew better than to steal from the Dragonborn.

She was a wonderful horse, with glowing white hair and main, as well as strong enough to fend off a bear. No one else had managed to tame the mare until Lorana had forced her to submit after twelve straight hours of bucking, and she remains the only person able to ride her. Mil seemed a loyal horse, as she never ran away when Lorana stepped off her.

She finds Wilhelm, the local innkeeper, feeding Mil her feed and petting her head. A thought comes through her mind to try the shout now and scare him...but he always takes such good care of her horse she decides against it. Lorana walks up to the Mil's other side and stroke her side.

"Good morning Wilhelm! Any problems you need help with?" she asks with a dazzling smile. He couldn't help but smile back before preparing the saddle.

"Well, the Jarl has placed a bounty on a local giant..."

"BORING!" she yells out.

"That's unusual, you usually love killing giants." He finished securing the saddle and a second later Lorana was up on top and ready to go. She tossed a few coins to the innkeeper and smirked.

"True, but I've found something much more interesting for now."

Why hunt giants when everything can be giant! She thought. With that, she had Mil sprint out of the town towards the distant woods.


After a few hours of riding, Lorana had found a decent location. Even she realized that trying to shrink among people would be dangerous. Her amazing power and accomplishments had earned her a good number of enemies and rivals. It would be best to test it out in the wilderness, where only weak animals could attack. She was confident that she could use her strength to kill them even at an inch tall. Or Mil could protect her and help her escape.

Now, what was it her father told her about the shout? Something about how long she would remain tiny. Well, it didn't really matter. She had waited long enough to try this out! Not noticing her pale horse walking off to the nearby stream (a common habit of hers) Lorana began to shout.
13111.title: Among Nature

choices: A furry hand
A scaly hand
A green hand
131112.content:
Lorana squealed in excitement as the ground quickly rushed up towards her. This was so exciting! She ran out of her armor into the wide open space before her.

Everything was giant! She had successfully shrunken herself to the size of an insect! From what she remembered, by saying only two of the words she shouldn't be stuck like this forever. Looking over her shoulder, she saw that her horse had wandered off again.

"Oh Mil, the one time I really need you...Oh well! The only thing out here are foxes and skeevers anyway." With this, she began to explore her new stature. Being an adventurer at heart, she couldn't help but run towards new and dangerous things. She moved away from her worldly possessions and trekked deeper into the woods.

Walked through the shrubbery proved to be a bit difficult however. Being an inch in height made her unable to go over the plants, and directly in line with their roots. She didn't mind though. It was beautiful inside the green life. Everything that had seemed so insignificant to her before had become greater than herself. She could see the veins in all the leaves. She could see every ridge on the outside of a plants bark. She could see the roaring campfire in the distance.

Wait, campfire? Walking closer, she could clearly make out a campsite in a nearby clearing. Funny, I didn't notice that before... she thought. She ran up to get a closer look. There was only a single tent, leading her to believe that it was a solo camp. However, upon closer inspection she found two bedrolls next to each other along with two satchels. It was a pair, likely romantically together based on the ruffled form of the bedrolls.

Lorana walked up to a discarded boot and compared herself to it. It was much larger than herself, but it also seemed much bigger than an average boot. Not liking the smell seeping from the cloth shoe, she starts to walk away for something else to catch her interest.

SWISH!

Swiftly doing a back roll, an arrow made of pure ebony landed directly where she was standing. Her battle mentality took over and she quickly sprinted in zigzags away from the archer. The arrows continued to rain down upon her, every second another one landed where she had previously been.

Damnit, it must have been a master. Just as she approached the bushes, another arrow landed directly in front of her.

"Seriously?! Another one?!" she exclaimed. In a flash, a hail of arrows made a perfect circle around her. Hearing the sound of a bow being pulled back, Lorana realized this could be the end.

"Hold fire! Hold fire, love!" a feminine voice rang out. Looking over Lorana witnessed a Redguard woman jump out of a nearby tree and land perfectly silent on the ground. The giant woman was upon Lorana in an instant with only a few large strides. Her dark hair cascaded down her back and her golden brown eyes gazed with a concerned look.

"It...it's a tiny person, not a mouse..." she said, clearly shocked.

"Heh, even better" said a deeper, yet still feminine voice. Suddenly Lorana was snatched up by...
131112.title: A few days, will she last?

choices: A bear
Mil
A bathing woman!
131113.content:
A sensation of falling overtook Lorana as the entire world seemed to grow larger. Large trees became wooden columns scaling ungodly heights. The low shrubbery became large thickets. As the ground came closer and closer she began to notice that her clothes and equipment wasn't shrinking with her!

Soon enough, she was standing on a pile of leather armor. Her broadsword lay harmlessly in its sheathe behind her. The naked girl was a little relieved she had shrunk out here so that no one could see her bare form. That was only for her future partner eyes. Not realizing the danger she had just placed herself in, Lorana was awestruck.

"This is amazing! Everything seems so large!" she exclaimed. She stepped out of her pile and placed her bare feet on the dirt below. She was so small that even the grass was her height.

That's when she heard it. A small growl from the bushes. Her warrior's instincts took over and she dove back into her clothes. Looking back she was shocked to see that a enormous skeever had just lunged at her.

A normal skeever is fairly common in Skyrim. The giant rat creatures were about the size of dogs. A large group of them could be dangerous, but a lone skeever is hardly worth an arrow. Lorana had recently tested her abilities by seeing how many punches it would take to kill one. THe answer was one.

But now that she was tiny, she felt more scared of this beast than the first time she fought a dragon. The beast locked eyes with her again and lunged towards her hiding place! Lorana panicked and tried shielding herself with her arms and closing her eyes. She felt an impact...and then nothing.

She opened her eyes to see a long pink tongue, black gums, and a gaping throat. Above her she saw yellow teeth had punctured her armor, but the rat's weak jaws couldn't bend the leather! Her bravado began to resurface as she stood and walked over to the mouth.

"Ha! Serves you right you disease ridden rodent!" she exclaimed. "Do you believe you could make a meal out of me?! Watch, I'll even help you!" She boldly stepped forward, placing her bare feet directly onto the skeever's tongue!

The warm muscle felt oddly pleasant against her skin, far nicer than any bedroll she had spent a night on. However it was rather difficult to keep her balance on the shifting floor. The smell inside was pretty terrible, but she quickly adjusted. The skeever was making some hissing noises, it was likely trying to get loose to swallow her. A lot more saliva was being produced around her, the beast clearly enjoying her flavor. She rubbed her feet across the tongue, teasing the monster.

Taking a few more steps forward, she came before the gaping hole of the throat. Gazing down the esophagus, light poured in to give her a partial view of the fleshy tunnel. The end of her vision was a bend leading to its stomach. For a second, an odd sense of longing came over Lorana. She wanted to go down this beast's throat, into its belly. Would she survive inside? Or would she end up as nutrition for some low level rodent? But her mind brushed it off as curiosity and she continued her torment.

"Oh, I bet you would love for me to go down there, huh? To slide down your throat and become just another piece of meat? Well guess what? I've eaten plenty of skeevers in my travels, and I've killed them with just THIS!" She cocked back her arm and threw her fist into the soft flesh in the back of the throat.

Lorana had expected the skeever to at least yelp in pain. Instead, it felt a chance and raised its tongue, trying to swallow her! As she fell towards the tube, Lorana finally realized how dangerous being tiny was. Allowing her instincts to take over again, she swung her body around and latched onto a jagged tooth as the rest of her body fell into the throat.

Immediately, the throat muscles gripped her legs and pulled like a group of horses were tied to them. She tightened her grip and pulled as hard as she could just to keep from being pulled down. Looking out, she saw that the skeever almost had its teeth out of her armor.

This was it. All of her adventures would come to an end inside a skeever of all things. Once it was free, it would easily swallow her. Also, however strong she was at normal size at an inch tall her limit was keeping the throat muscles at bay.

No! She was not going to die in some rat! Her ancestors would laugh at her centuries! She would never enter Sovengarde! Taking a deep breath, she shouted in the ancient dragon tongue.

"WULD, NAH, KEST!"

In an instant, the whirlwind sprint shot her forward back into her armor. Her heart was racing at an incredible rate. Her confidence nearly got her killed! Just because she could kill animals at her normal height doesn't mean that she could while shrunk. If she had a sword at her size, it would be different. But unarmed, she could do nothing.

Just as she began regain her calm, she heard the sound of teeth pulling out. Looking back, the skeever was pissed. Her little tease had only made it hungrier. It began to squirm its way into the armor towards Lorana!

Jumping to her feet, she sprints out of the sleeve and back into the open. As the rodent struggles to escape, she sprints towards the sound of a stream. Since Mil wasn't around to kill the skeever, she must have went to get a drink. If she could make it to her, no other predator could come after her.

As she pushes her way through some shrubbery, she hears the rat breaking free and coming after her. Gathering up all her strength, Lorana sprints as hard as she can before bursting out and hitting the water. The small stream from earlier was gone, replaced with a rushing river.

But that wasn't the important part. The important part was that she couldn't stop herself from running directly into...

Looking far into the sky, she could make out the outline of her trusted horse, Mil! Taking a breath of relief, she wrapped her arms around her hoof tightly out of the sheer joy of being free from the monstrous skeever. Lorana waved her arms while smiling at her companion for taking notice of her. But something was off. The look passing through her eyes wasn't the usual look of respect. She appeared confused at why a tiny insect looked and sounded like her master. A quick lick across her equestrian lips made Lorana shiver again.

But she had never shown the rebellious animal weakness before. The only reason she was able to ride her was simply because she had proven to be the more powerful one. Even when she slept Mil had been tied up out of reach.

Now that Lorana was vulnerable, would the carnivorous equestrian consume her like she did the bear? Or would she hold loyalty to her kind master? Neither question was answered at the moment due to a familiar hissing coming from the bushes behind Lorana.

The nord jumped back into the water while Mil turned to face the intruder. Soon enough, the gray rat comes into view. Saliva was coming out of its snout as it stared at the pair. Mil let out a warning snort while stepping forward. However, the skeever would not back down as it focused on the horse.

take her to the nearest town.

Mil simply opened her mouth as the skeever flew towards her. The terrified rodent could do nothing as it harmlessly flew into her maw. After a quick swallow, the monster that had nearly ended the small warrior's life wiggled down the horse's throat to join the bear inside.

The horse's mouth was much softer than the skeever's, her body sinking into the squishy tongue. The heat was also much greater without fresh air circling through, also causing the smell of saliva to be more intense.

From the back of the throat, she could hear the bear's cries of anger. If Mil decided to swallow, then she would likely be swallowed by the bear as well. Then the skeever. Eaten three times over...such a horrible fate. Her struggling proved fruitless against the soft flesh around her, so she stopped trying. Trying to regain her composure, Lorana decides to try one last effort to save her life.

"Mil...Mil it's me, Lorana. Please don't eat me, girl...I've always been so kind to you. I took care of you, kept you fed, and always exercised you. I thought I had been a good master. So please...for the sake of everything we've been through don't swallow..."

While the war horse understood everything, she ignored it. She was incredibly annoyed at her master for putting herself in such great danger again. Her words made no effect on her as she began to do what she had planned on doing since she first discovered the tiny nord. Mil began to...

13111323.content:

Unfortunately for her however, her distraction proved the perfect opportunity for a third predator to throw its hat into the ring, Lorana realizing her mistake a moment too late as gaint paws pressed down on her back, pinning her in place. Lorana shifted uncomfortably as a terribly loud snuffling sound came from directly behind her, craning to spot the beast that had so easily defeated her, only to see a squirrel perched over her body. While the squirrel investigated its catch, the Skeever was crying its last, however, and the loud reminder of the risk it was in prompted the creature to scoop its prey up and run off to enjoy it.

For Lorana, the experience was miserable. In seconds she was scooped off the ground and unceremoniously dumped into the squirrel's mouth, where she found herself shoved into a cheek to be saved for later. The rocking motion of the squirrel running and climbing soon became almost hypnotic, and, in the cramped and hot space of its mouth, Lorana was finding it hard to stay awake, never mind fight back.

As soon as she hit the water, Lorana was taken by the current. Something so weak wouldn't have effected her, even at a mere inch in height. But the exhaustion from consecutively using two shouts, keeping herself from being swallowed, and running for her life left her exhausted.

At normal size, this stream would have been knee deep, maybe waist deep in the middle. Unable to fight it, all she could do was float and let the current take her gently down. The freezing cold water was actually relaxing upon her nord skin. She was praying to all nine divines individually to bless her with a miracle. Hearing a familiar hiss, she prayed harder. The skeever was almost upon her.

As she finished her prayer to Mara, she was given an answer. She felt her head bump into something soft and she opened her eyes. In an instant she could believe that Dibella herself was before her. A beautiful nord woman was rising high into sky, her head blocking the sun. The only thing on her body was an amulet of Mara.

The woman had pale skin, a lean and muscular form, and long red hair. A few freckles could be seen around her nose. Unlike Lorana, her skin was clear of any unsightly scars. Her breasts were incredibly large, to the point that she must have her armor custom made. After a few more moments of staring, she realized that she had bumped into this woman's thigh. And that she was staring back at her.

"Oh my, what do we have here?" she asked with a voice as soothing as honeyed milk. A large, soft hand came underneath her and carried her into the sky in front of her face. Her bright green eyes stared at her softly and expectantly.

"H-help me..." she managed to squeak out. Not just from the exhaustion, she was awestruck. It might have been due to her small perspective, but she really gave off the impression of a goddess. I really need to remember to make a huge donation to Mara the next time I'm in Riften she thought.

"Help you? With what?" as she said this, a loud hiss was heard as the skeever leaped out of the bushes towards the hand Lorana was on! Her body had become completely soaked in saliva and even the brave nord warrior let out a whimper as the muscle gave several licks to the face.

The dragon's tongue then wrapped around her and squeezed tightly before lifting her up. Fear shot through her veins as she was sure the monster had woken up. Instead, it brought its tongue back to its original resting place while closing its jaws to savor its treat. Darkness filled the maw as the sharp fangs came together, blocking out the sun. That could be the last time she saw the sun. After a few more minutes of licking and suckling, the tongue relaxed and Lorana fell onto a hard floor of teeth.

A blush was over her face as she realized that despite the fear, the massage given from the tongue had felt amazing. Returning to the task at hand, she resumed her crawling towards the throat. She moved even slower than before out of fear of falling in without seeing it. Holding a hand out in front of her, she reached for where the uvula should be. 1353.content:
Everybody acts irrationally when they get angry, some more so than others. Deciding that she needed to save her friends immediately, Lorana lifted her axe and charged forward, and was instantly met face-to-face with the massive dragon.

Covered in red scales, the dragon turned to face the charging Nord head on, staring her down with hungry, predatory eyes. It's long, powerful neck connected its head to its torso, the tan flesh of its throat extending all the way down to its underbelly, which was round with a stomach full of prey. Lorana charged, yelling her fiercest battle cry and brandishing her sword. The dragon turned to her and opened its maw, saliva dripping from its dark, slimy flesh. Then, at the last moment, Lorana brought up her shield, intending to charge right through its fireball and strike right at its head.

Unfortunately for the Nord, she was dead wrong. Instead of launching the fireball she expected, the dragon lunged forward and chomped down on her body, causing her to yelp with surprise as its teeth bore down on her midsection, sending her front half face-first into its slimy tongue as her legs dangled. Then, without hesitating a single moment, the dragon hurled her up in the air, sending her flying as her sword and shield went in opposite directions..

Lorana flew up in the air for a brief moment before falling back down, having a brief recollection of fighting giants who sent their opponents flying, before falling right into the open mouth of the dragon. Lorana was instantly trapped in the dark, humid prison of the dragon's maw, sending its breath washing over her as its jaws snapped shut, sealing her inside. Lorana only had time to scream before the beast threw its head back, sending her tumbling across its slimy tongue and coating her body in its viscous saliva before landing with a splat in the back of its throat.

A moment later, the flesh beneath Lorana gave way as the walls squeezed on her from all sides, forcing her down into the tight, fleshy darkness as the dragon swallowed her with a heavy gluuurk.
1353.title: Swallowed Whole and Alive

The dragon settles down, and begins to digest its meal...
13531.content:
The bulge slowly traveled down the dragon's throat, making a cute little lump as if the dragon were simply having a bit bite to eat - which it was. Lorana winced in pain and disgust as she slowly slid down the mighty dragon's gullet, the hot, fleshy walls squeezing hard on her body and slowly forcing her downward. As she sunk deeper into the dragon's body, the temperature suddenly became oppressively hot, coupled with her own pain of being swallowed whole and alive.

Moments later, Lorana slid out of the dragon's throat and landed face-first into its rumbling belly, splashing down into a pool of hot mucus and bodily fluids. All at once, the helpless Nord was instantly assaulted by the rank depths of the dragon's innards. The heavy, stagnant "air" that hung was hardly breathable, but instead carried the aura of rotten flesh and painful suffering. The dark, fleshy walls slowly pulsated as they churned the contents of the dragon's stomach, sloshing the pool of mucus around with little splashes and filling the cavern with the thick, guttural groaning of its bodily processes, interspersed with the dull thud of its heartbeat, echoing all about.

gerrrn, gluuuurgle, glorp

Lorana turned to the back of the dragon's churning belly, and suddenly found her friends - exactly where she thought they'd be, having already been swallowed by the dragon. Two of them - the males, the first two eaten - were already passed out, and the two other girls seemed to be struggling as well.

Lorana waded over to her friend Aeta, who seemed to be struggling to stay conscious. The Nord crouched down to her friend, whose clothes were already falling off in tatters. "Aeta! Aeta!"

"L-Lorana..." the girl struggled to say. "Is that... you? What... what happened to us?"

guuuurgle

Lorana gasped as a sudden lurching of the beast's stomach threw her off-balance. "We..." she began, struggling to accept the truth herself. "The dragon... swallowed us whole. We're... inside of its stomach..." Lorana turned, ready to vomit, but managed to regain composure.

"Well..." Aeta began again, a twinge of hopelessness in her voice. "What... what are we going to do?"

Lorana considered her options. Things were looking pretty grim for them...
13531.title: Belly Full of Nords

choices: Lorana and party digest into nothing but nourishment for the dragon
The dragon absorbs their souls!
135312.content:
As the full dragon soars through the air, its mighty, swaying belly rumbles and swings back and forth with each flap of its powerful wings. Feeling full and contented after its last battle - and meal - the powerful beast approaches a clearing high up on one of Skyrim's many mountains, and slowly descends. Landing on the ground with a powerful thump, the dragon stretches its wings and yawns loudly, before feeling the beginnings of a mighty belch reverberate up its throat.

*BRAAAAP*

Inside of the dragon's saturated stomach, Lorana yelps as the slimy walls begin to violently pulsate, throwing her to the fleshy floor as the massive organ slowly begins to churn, sloshing its prey back and forth and splashing them with waves of stomach juices.

"A-Aeta... what's happening?" Lorana cries, crawling over to her friend as the stomach gurgles loudly.

*gerrrrn*

The dragon curls up on the ground, laying its head down, content to take a nap and feel its rumbling belly gurgle. Inside of its stomach, Lorana screams as the stomach rumbles incredibly loudly, before beginning to spray its contents with burning hot stomach acids, completely coating her and her friends' bodies as the level of fluids slowly starts to rise.

"AETA!" Lorana screams, yelping in pain as the burning stomach acids wash over her. "What's happening?!"

"Lorana..." her friend begins, overtaken with despair, "the dragon... it's digesting us..."

Lorana screamed, tears filling her eyes as the stomach acids continued to rise. "Why is it doing that?!"

"Well, we're it's food now..." Aeta replied, and sighed. All the while, the stomach continued to churn louder and louder, and faster and faster, before it was soon impossible to stay above the frothing torrent of stomach acids. Lorana screamed as she wrapped around Aeta in an embrace, her body beginning to go numb with pain as the stomach acids wash over her, melting her away as the sleeping dragon digests its food.
135312.title: Dragon's Full Digestion

1353121.content:
I can't believe I'm gonna die in some dragon's stinking gut... Despairing as her limp body is thrown from one end of the gurgling, churning stomach to the other. Unable to last very long in the sloshing torrent of stomach acids, Lorana soon succumbs as her body melts away into paste, her last thoughts of how unlikely it'll be that she gets a proper burial.

Meanwhile, the dragon happily sleeps away, unaware of its meals digesting away in its churning stomach as so many have before. From outside, a nearby deer looks on to see its bloated belly, making all sorts of noises as it digests its food, echoing all throughout the forest. Sensing danger, the deer runs away.

~ ~ ~

Hours pass, and the dragon awakes from its nap. Its belly is much less bloated as its stomach is empty, having long since pumped its digested food into its intestines. Feeling its veins surge with the power of its digested meals, the dragon rises, eager to take flight and continue its path of destruction.

Right before the dragon leaves, it bends its lower body downward, lifting its tail as it squats. Having passed through the dragon's stomach and intestines, the dragon's food only has one logical exit, of which the dragon is ready to relieve itself. With a bit of pressure exerted, the dragon pushes forth a long, thick coil of waste from its anus, dropping down into a pile beneath its backside.

Finishing off its relief and feeling its belly rumble with hunger, the dragon takes to the skies again. All that's left behind now is a steaming, coiled pile of fresh dragon shit. A few broken, corroded bones can be seen poking out of the steaming pile, the only evidence of Lorana and the other Nords who went down the dragon's throat and faced its belly. Having lost the fight, their fate as a few steamy after-meal droppings is sealed.

14.content:
In the Elder Scrolls Universe, "Daedra" generally refers to the inhabitants of Oblivion. These creatures can come in all sorts of different shapes and forms, serving various masters but usually spelling trouble for mortals in some way or another...

Choose your Daedra!

1. Dremora - Dremora are humanoid Daedra often skilled with weapon and armor use or with magical abilities that resemble demonic warriors or knights. They most commonly serve Mehrunes Dagon, and have darkened, ashy features with horns and other such characteristics, complete with deep, harsh voices and violent, aggressive tendencies. They are commonly found in Daedric ruins and the plains of Oblivion, especially inhabiting towers.
(Reference picture: http://www.uesp.net/w/images/a/ac/SR-npc... )

2. Winged Twilight - A demonic, batlike creature resembling a harpy that is usually associated with Azura. Winged Twilights are always female, and boast powerful magical resistances as well as abilities of their own. Most commonly found in Morrowind, Winged Twilights are most often spotted in Daedric ruins but can also be seen in simple ancestral tombs, hunting for unsuspecting prey...
(Reference picture: http://www.uesp.net/w/images/8/8d/MW-cre... )

3. Daedroth - A humongous form of lesser Daedra resembling a muscled, anthropomorphic crocodile or reptile of some sort. Contrary to other types of daedra, Daedroth are more beastlike and savage, sacrificing weapon skill for sheer size and brute strength. Usually androgynous or genderfluid, Daedroth are among the most commonly found types of Daedra in the plains of Oblivion, and are associated with Mehrunes Dagon or Molag Bal.
(Reference picture: http://www.uesp.net/w/images/f/fc/ON-cre... )

4. Spider Daedra - Dridders with a humanoid upper torso and an arachnid lower half. Spider Daedra are most commonly associated with Mephala and, similar to the Winged Twilight, are most commonly found as females. They usually have very little skin covered apart from their natural body armor, and can boast superior web-making abilities for the purpose of immobilizing and consuming prey.
(Reference picture: http://www.uesp.net/w/images/9/98/ON-cre... )

5. Daedric Prince - These are the revered Daedric gods and goddesses. Although technically genderfluid, many of them take on specific masculine or feminine forms (despite the term "prince") and can choose to interact with mortals as such. Wielding incredible power and influence, the 16 or so Daedric Princes are often worshipped by inhabitants of Tamriel as an older, more pagan religion. Some of the most famous Daedric Princes are credited with creating entire races of people or are associated with the appearance of some of the most powerful artifacts known to man, so it comes as no surprise that their powers are all but omnipotent...

The Winged Twilight's eyes snapped open as she awoke from her nap, stirring herself awake in the deepest chamber of the Arano Ancestral Tomb. Though tombs were often guarded by the undead, some, such as this one on the southern tip of Tel Branora's island in Morrowind, had its own Daedra inhabitants instead.

A servant of Azura like all other Winged Twilights, Zeneva was just as beautiful and dangerous as her scaly counterparts, although perhaps even more predatory. Zeneva rouses herself awake as her mind wanders to the events of the tomb's last intrusion: a lone Dunmer girl, creeping around, looking for her share of grave-robbing plunder. Unluckily for her, however, Zeneva tolerated no such plundering at her tomb, and made quick work of the intruder: first, by disarming her, second, by eating her whole and alive, and third, by dozing off with a squirming, screaming belly full of fresh dark elf meat.

Awakening from that nap, Zeneva found all but every trace of evidence of the would-be thief's existence in the world gone. What was before a bulging, squirming gut was now nothing more than a small pudge on the Winged Twilight's otherwise toned belly. Feeling her massive, bared breasts sway as she stands up to her full height, the winged predator begins making a mental note of the new, raw power she feels flowing through her veins, before being interrupted by a heavy pressure in her lower abdomen.

Retreating to some dusty, otherwise empty corner of the tomb's dark halls, Zeneva squats down and makes quick work of relieving herself, culminating her last prey's entire life in the form of a steaming pile complete with corroded chunks of bone. Heading out of the otherwise unused chamber, Zeneva begins to prowl her musty halls once again, wondering how to spend the next few hours...
